summaryText: In this powerful New Year's sermon, Pastor Chris Durso delivers a transformative message about being a student of God's word versus being a spiritual 'scavenger'. Isn't it incredible how we often settle for secondhand spiritual experiences when God is inviting us into direct relationship? Chris breaks down the difference between those who merely collect spiritual soundbites and those who truly study and apply God's word. He challenges us to become intentional students who not only read the Bible but allow the Bible to read us! The sermon powerfully illustrates how knowing Scripture intimately can help us stand firm during life's storms, just like Jesus did when confronted by Satan's temptations. Pastor Chris uses his personal story of overcoming a learning disability to demonstrate how God can use anyone who commits to studying His word. The message is a rallying cry for believers to stop being passive consumers of Christianity and start actively engaging with God's transformative truth.
mainPoints: Students study the word proactively, not reactively
Allow God's word to examine and transform you
Use Scripture as a weapon against spiritual battles

versesMentioned.text: Study to show thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.

The tempter came to him and said, 'If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.' Jesus answered, 'It is written: Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.'

This is what we speak, not in words taught us by human wisdom but in words taught by the Spirit, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words. The person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God but considers them foolishness, and cannot understand them because they are discerned only through the Spirit.
No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 119:11: 'I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you.'
Monday.focus: Developing a consistent scripture reading habit
Monday.action: Create a Bible reading plan. Choose a book of the Bible and commit to reading one chapter daily. Journal your reflections and insights.
Monday.prayer: Lord, give me a hunger for Your word. Help me to prioritize reading and understanding Your scriptures. Open my heart to receive Your truth. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Joshua 1:8: 'Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then you will be prosperous and successful.'
Tuesday.focus: Meditating on scripture throughout the day
Tuesday.action: Set phone reminders to pause and reflect on a specific verse. Memorize one scripture verse today.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me not just read Your word, but truly internalize it. Make Your scriptures come alive in my heart and mind. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 2 Timothy 3:16-17: 'All Scripture is God-breathed and is useful for teaching, rebuking, correcting and training in righteousness.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding the transformative power of scripture
Wednesday.action: Identify one area of your life where you need correction or growth. Find a scripture that speaks directly to this challenge.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, expose any areas in my life that need Your correction. Give me the humility to receive Your guidance through Your word. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Hebrews 4:12: 'For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.'
Thursday.focus: Allowing scripture to examine your heart
Thursday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal any hidden attitudes or thoughts that need transformation.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, search my heart. Reveal any areas that are not aligned with Your will. Give me the courage to surrender and change. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 6:17: 'Take the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.'
Friday.focus: Using scripture as a spiritual weapon
Friday.action: Practice responding to a personal challenge or temptation with a specific scripture, just as Jesus did.
Friday.prayer: God, teach me to wield Your word as a weapon against spiritual battles. Give me wisdom and discernment. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 55:11: 'So is my word that goes out from my mouth: It will not return to me empty, but will accomplish what I desire and achieve the purpose for which I sent it.'
Saturday.action: Review the scriptures you've studied this week. Reflect on how God's word is working in your life.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your living, active word. Continue to shape and mold me through Your truth. I trust in Your promises. Amen.
